Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating because it states that the new nuclear power plant is the first in three decades, when in fact there have been other plants built during that time period.
Understate: The claim may understate the number of new nuclear power plants built in the past three decades by not acknowledging the existence of other plants.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support to back up the statement that it is the first new nuclear power plant in three decades.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing a clear explanation of why it has been so long since a license was granted for a new nuclear power plant.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the long gap between new nuclear power plant licenses, such as regulatory or safety concerns.
